page.title: 07The Gravel Pits
page.content:
There are gravel pits on the road out of{Marlow.}We saw the gravel being washed. The dredger puts in into the boat and seives it. We saw the muddy water coming out. There are two tugs and three cranes.
The gravel is used to build houses and make cement. There is a weighbridge there.
Where they have finished taking out the gravel, there are coots, swans and grebes. We saw lots of blue dragonflies and ducks and swallows swooping down for food.
The lake is stocked with fish for the Angling Club and they have planted many new trees.
